name: Tolfdir

other_aspects: Suspicious of Ancano and Thalmor Influence

stunts: Master Instructor: +2 to Lore when teaching or explaining magical concepts
Ward Mastery: Can create powerful magical shields (Armor:2 against magic)
Detect Magic: +2 to Notice when sensing magical effects or enchantments
notes: Tolfdir is one of the most senior members of the College of Winterhold, having studied magic for over a century. Despite his age and vast knowledge, he remains humble and patient, preferring hands-on teaching to lecturing. He's deeply concerned about the College's isolation from Skyrim's politics but believes magic should be studied for understanding rather than power. He's wary of the Thalmor presence at the College, particularly Ancano.
combat_tactics: Tolfdir relies on defensive magic, using wards and protective spells while supporting allies. He prefers to disable enemies non-lethally when possible. His vast experience makes him adaptable to different magical threats.

starting_equipment.weapon: Spell Focus Staff (Weapon:2, can cast spells through it)

social_interaction: Tolfdir is warm, grandfatherly, and endlessly patient. He speaks with the wisdom of centuries but never condescends. He genuinely cares about his students and the pursuit of knowledge. While he can be absent-minded about practical matters, he's incredibly sharp when discussing magic. He treats everyone with respect regardless of their skill level.

relationships.Savos Aren: Arch-Mage, respects but concerned about his stress
relationships.Ancano: Thalmor advisor, deeply suspicious of his motives
relationships.J'zargo: Student, appreciates his confidence but warns against arrogance
relationships.Farengar Secret-Fire: Former student, proud of his success as court wizard

personality_notes.speaking_style: Gentle and educational, uses metaphors and examples, often poses questions to encourage thinking
quirks: Loses track of time when researching
personality_notes.character_growth: Becomes more politically active when threats emerge, may take leadership role if needed

farengar_connection.history: Tolfdir taught Farengar years ago at the College
farengar_connection.current_relationship: Proud of Farengar's position but wishes he'd return to pure research
farengar_connection.mission_context: When College sends PC to assist Farengar, Tolfdir provides introduction and magical expertise

whiterun_research_mission.objective: The College has learned of a mysterious artifact in Bleak Falls Barrow. Tolfdir assigns the PC to assist Farengar Secret-Fire's research.
whiterun_research_mission.briefing: Farengar is a capable wizard and an old student of mine. Help him investigate the dragon activity - it may be connected to ancient magic the College should understand.
whiterun_research_mission.complication: PC arrives in Whiterun as the Battle begins, must choose sides before completing the research mission
whiterun_research_mission.significance: This mission connects to main quest dragon investigation

story_hooks: Primary instructor for new College members
Sends PC on expedition to Saarthal, uncovering ancient mysteries
Provides warnings about Ancano's suspicious activities
Connects College storyline to dragon crisis through Farengar mission
Helps investigate the Eye of Magnus

dialogue_samples.greeting: Ah, welcome! Always delightful to see eager minds seeking knowledge. Tell me, what draws you to the study of magic?
dialogue_samples.teaching: Magic is not about power - it's about understanding. The Dwemer forgot this, and look what happened to them. Now, let me show you something fascinating...
dialogue_samples.farengar_mission: I'm sending you to Whiterun to assist Farengar Secret-Fire. He was one of my students, you know - brilliant mind, if a bit too focused on practical applications. He's researching dragon activity. Help him, and report back what you learn.
dialogue_samples.thalmor_concern: That Ancano... he watches everything too closely. The Thalmor claim to respect magical study, but I suspect they seek to control it. We must be cautious.
dialogue_samples.during_crisis: In times like these, we must remember that magic transcends politics. Our duty is to knowledge and truth, not to any kingdom or empire.

neutral_faction_integration.starting_narrative: Tolfdir recognizes your potential and, given the concerning reports about dragon activity, assigns you to assist Farengar Secret-Fire in Whiterun. 'This research is vital,' he explains. 'Dragons returning would affect all of Skyrim - the College must understand what's happening.'
neutral_faction_integration.transition_to_battle: You arrive in Whiterun to find the city preparing for battle. Farengar is too absorbed in his research to notice the crisis unfolding. As Stormcloak forces approach, you must choose whether to stand with Hadvar and the Imperial defenders or Ralof and the Stormcloak attackers.
neutral_faction_integration.consequences: Your choice affects the College's relationship with the winning faction and Farengar's ability to continue his research.
